item.title: Anchor gains IAB certification
item.description:
A big move from the largest podcast host in the world. Plus, Alec Baldwin moves from WNYC to iHeart; and podcasting is going well for Westwood One
Visit https://podnews.net/update/anchor-is-iab-certified for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/anchor-is-iab-certified for all the links, and to subscribe.

  • Anchor, the largest podcast host in the world, has achieved IAB Certification for their podcast analytics. Here's their full certificate. We've updated our podcast hosts page. As a small warning: "some podcasters may notice a very slight decline in play counts as a result," the company says; though some that have contacted Podnews have seen significant drops.
  • Here's the Thing with Alec Baldwin is to move to iHeart. The show has been with WNYC since 2011. ‚ÄúWith the shift over to iHeartRadio, we‚Äôre breathing new life into a project I‚Äôve been passionate about for nearly a decade,‚Äù Baldwin said, though did criticise WNYC for interfering with his editorial independence.

    • In the same Billboard article, iHeart's Conal Byrne says "Spotify accounts for somewhere between five and 12% of listening" of podcasts from iHeart, and suggests that exclusives are bad for creators, brands, and listeners. iHeart remains the top US podcast publisher, according to Podtrac's October numbers.
  • iOS 14.2 is out. Podcasters may notice it's increased the cover art size of podcasts on the lock screen.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

üéß Today in Digital Marketing — Every weekday, Tod Maffin brings you a fast-paced 8-minute rundown of what you missed in the world of podcast marketing, digital advertising, and social media. You can't afford to NOT listen.

PodcastersDirectory.com Accepting FREE Listings! — Largest Marketplace for Podcasters! Claim Your FREE Listing and be Connected Automatically with Guests, Podcasters and Industry Resources Like Never Before! Inspired by Members! Powered by Partners!

  • iHeartRadio Australia, which is run by ARN, is to have a "complete strategic overhaul". "Part of my role here is to make sure that we don‚Äôt lose focus and get distracted by new, shiny toys," says ARN's Content Director, Duncan Campbell.
  • The host of The History of Ancient Greece, Ryan Stitt, has been accused of sending multiple women abusive and sexually inappropriate messages and images. The podcaster, who has previously defended other men accused of sexual harrassment, has deleted his Twitter account.
  • The New York Times has seen a 19% increase in podcast revenue in the first nine months of 2020, according to its latest quarterly report. The Daily is the #1 US podcast, according to new Podtrac figures for October.
  • Westwood One's owner Cumulus Media says podcasting revenue was up 50% in the last quarter, and that the network achieved 102m downloads in September, up 47% year-on-year. "Digital dollars represented over 10% of revenue in the quarter," added CFO Frank Lopez-Balboa.
  • Remote recording software Riverside·fm has raised $2.5m in funding.

Tips and tricks

  • How To Use TikTok To Promote Your Podcast (We Edit Podcasts)
  • 7 signs it's time to invest in a professional podcast studio (Sounder)

Podcast News

  • On Vurbl Voices, Paul talks with the co-founders of KidNuz about the audio news format, storytelling, crafting your voice, distributing to the classroom and opportunities around audio for kids and families. Listen on Vurbl
  • The Q'd Up Podcast on Podcasting - 19'16" in, Jay "Podvader" Soderberg claims: "Chartable, who is IABv2 certified, tells me my podcast (Next Fan Up) gets three times the amount of downloads that my IABv2 certified host tells me I get." Hmm.

Our supporters:

Gold supporters:Riverside.fm, Buzzsprout, Resonate Recordings, WideOrbit, Voxnest, Jar Audio, Simplecast, Awesound, Call for Content, Podimo, Podcorn, Acast, ART19, Chant, Himalaya, Focusrite, Libsyn, One of One Productions Podcast Studio, Amazon Music, Luminary, The Roost, The Podcast Haven, Entale, Megaphone, Adonde Media, Podpage websites, backtracks.fm, Evergreen Podcasts, Engle, Knit, We Edit Podcasts, Legal Talk Network, Spotify for Podcasters

item.title: Anchor makes payout changes
item.description:
A company helps with piracty on YouTube; Mark Cuban at PMV; Whooskhaa launches cloud studio
Visit https://podnews.net/update/anchor-payment for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/anchor-payment for all the links, and to subscribe.

  • Anchor has changed its sponsorship payouts to podcasters. Now, there's a $10 minimum for cash withdrawls, and you'll need to wait four times as long for your initial payments: which may also take longer to get to your bank. The changes have happened at some point since October 7 according to the internet archive, but the date on their documentation still says 2018. (These changes may, however, make Anchor less attractive to those who pirate podcasts on the platform.)
  • Yesterday, we noted that YouTube, too, contains pirated podcasts - copied and uploaded without the podcaster's consent. Takedown Torrent LLC contacts us, telling us they find, report and remove pirated podcasts and other content from streaming video sites like YouTube and Vimeo. "Our clients have found that removal of pirated content from streaming video sites has increased their normal podcast downloads," they say. (If only there was some way they could attract more business...!).
  • In Australia, the former head of ABC Audio Studios Kellie Riordan has launched a new audio consultancy, Deadset Studios; and a new podcast, Curveball which explains how you too can tackle life‚Äôs toughest moments, and come out on top.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

Join our Affiliate prog. Alitu: The Podcast Maker — Earn 20% in recurring commissions, if your audience is content creators, marketers, entrepreneurs, coaches... Review the tool, write a guide or ask us for other ideas!

Become a Podcaster - Tell Your Story — Online workshop starts Jan 11. Register now for this 5-week, part-time online course to learn the art of podcasting directly from professional radio producers and podcasters.

PM Virtual Recordings Available Now! — featuring over nearly 100 hours of on-demand video from sessions that happened live at the world's largest virtual podcasting event. Topics from growth to measurement to creative, and a lot more!

  • Mark Cuban spoke at Podcast Movement Virtual - if you missed it, Podcast Movement have posted his full keynote with Erica Mandy from The NewsWorthy.
  • Whooshkaa has launched the Whooskhaa Cloud Studio, a way to record and edit podcasts using nothing more than a web browser.
  • Podomatic has announced two new partnerships with Podcorn and Whatfor Apparel - allowing monetisation for any sized podcast on the platform. Podomatic will forward any commission direct to the podcaster.
  • Podfan, a podcast membership company, now includes hosting for private podcasts with unlimited downloads.
  • Podcast ad-tech host Megaphone is still losing money but revenues increased significantly in the first nine months of 2020. Graham Holdings Company also owns Slate, Foreign Policy, and kids podcast publisher Pinna; all these companies lost money, though Pinna's revenue is also increasing.
  • Podcastle, a "next-gen podcast platform", has successfully raised $1.75m in funding. Podcastle, based in Armenia, converts text news/articles to a podcast.
  • Oxford Road has made three appointments to their executive team, including Steven Abraham as President.
  • Acast has launched a "Local Heroes" campaign, using podcasters to promote local independent businesses in Melbourne VIC, Australia - a city which has moved out of lockdown.
  • Midroll and Stitcher have announced a slate of new shows.

Tips and tricks

  • Three podcast principles for braver audio creativity (Tom Roach, Acast)\
  • How To Take A Podcast Break Without Losing Your Momentum (We Edit Podcasts)

Podcast News

  • On Vurbl Voices, Paul talks with the co-founders of KidNuz about the audio news format, storytelling, crafting your voice, distributing to the classroom and opportunities around audio for kids and families. Listen on Vurbl
  • On The Media's Bob Garfield is the guest on Oxford Road Presents: The Divided States of Media. Recorded yesterday, Bob Garfield describes himself as "at my wit's end" - and it's Bob as you've never heard him before.
  • That Gaby Roslin Podcast is "all about having a good time, celebrating positivity and spreading kindness". This UK broadcaster's podcast is produced by Cameo Productions, and has made it to episode 7 already.
  • A new explorative wellness podcast Sounds A Bit Woo Woo To Me launched yesterday, taking a deep-dive look into alternative therapies, spiritual practices and holistic wellbeing approaches.

Our supporters:

Gold supporters:Riverside.fm, Buzzsprout, Resonate Recordings, WideOrbit, Voxnest, Jar Audio, Simplecast, Awesound, Podimo, Call for Content, Podcorn, Acast, Amazon Music, Focusrite, We Edit Podcasts, One of One Productions Podcast Studio, backtracks.fm, Luminary, Chant, Megaphone, ART19, Himalaya, Spotify for Podcasters, Knit, The Roost, Podpage websites, Entale, Legal Talk Network, Libsyn, The Podcast Haven, Engle, Evergreen Podcasts, Adonde Media

item.title: YouTube channels are pirating podcasts
item.description:
Elsie Escobar notices something about microphone reviewers; iHeartPodcast Network in Australia expands
Visit https://podnews.net/update/youtube-pirates for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/youtube-pirates for all the links, and to subscribe.

  • Podcasts are being pirated on YouTube, if this channel is anything to go by. (We've confirmed that this is not an official channel). They're not alone. YouTube appears to have no audio watermarking to stop podcast piracy on their platform.
  • Dan Franks from Podcast Movement is interviewed about how their Virtual event went this year.
  • More partners for the iHeartPodcast Network in Australia - DM Podcasts (home of the Betoota Advocate), and the Australian Podcast Awards, for which they're making a podcast industry show.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

Paid Writers Needed @ ThePodcastHost.com — We're looking for great writers who know and love podcasting. We need gear reviews, audio tutorials, growth stories, monetisation examples, and we pay decent rates for it. Click above to apply!

Book experts as guests on your podcast for free — Select from over 500 experts covering every topic imaginable! See their one-sheet, how they'll promote YOUR show, and invite using a simple form. Find someone today!

üí∞ Interested in building a podcast membership? — Check out Supercast's free Guide to Podcast Memberships to learn how you can leverage a paid membership model on your podcast. Learn more ‚Üí

  • Elsie Escobar criticises Shure in the latest edition of The Feed from Libsyn, for seemingly giving every single one of their review units of the new Shure MV7 microphone to men. "It's not about wanting free stuff: it's the fact that there is an unrepresented community here. Consider expanding your relationships with just not the same dudes."

Tips and tricks

  • 8 Reasons To Turn Your Podcast Into A Book (We Edit Podcasts)\
  • How to name your podcast trailer (Pacific Content)

Podcast News

  • Podcasting and blogging pioneer Dave Winer is the guest on This Week In Startups
  • Podcasting Essentials this week features Omny Studio's Sharon Taylor, examining the podcasting trends of 2020 and what lies ahead. "She also explains secure distribution and helps us better understand podcast analytics".

Our supporters:

item.title: A brand new song, every week, in a podcast
item.description:
A new podcast promises a new song every week. The Daily goes live for today only. Buzzsprout has got IAB certification. Blinkist makes shows shorter
Visit https://podnews.net/update/song-a-week-podcast for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/song-a-week-podcast for all the links, and to subscribe.

üá∫üá∏ In the US? Please vote today. Preferably for that guy, rather than that guy. Thanks! üá∫üá∏

Brand safety is an easy checkmark on an otherwise long list of requests, so why aren‚Äôt more hosting platforms offering it? In this week's Sounds Profitable newsletter, Bryan Barletta explains Brand Safety and Brand Sensitivity, and how advertisers are increasingly using it. Go subscribe!

  • A brand new song, every week, on a podcast? The band Don‚Äôt Stop Or We‚Äôll Die is to launch SONG-A-WEEK, a new podcast that promises... a song a week. Patreon fans can get their names sung by the band on the podcast.
  • Buzzsprout has achieved IAB certification for podcast measurement, achieving it without any adjustments to their systems. "Our customers will not see any drop in their numbers", says co-founder Tom Rossi.

    • We have updated our list of podcast hosts, which lists all hosts with certified numbers.
  • Are podcasts are bit too long? Blinkist, which takes best-selling nonfiction books and produces a 15-minute summary, has launched Shortcasts, doing 15-minute versions of podcasts. Revisionist History from Pushkin Industries is one of the shows offered in Shortcast format, in collaboration with the podcast creators.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

Fiction Podcast or Audio Drama Junkie? Roll up! — Get the Fiction Podcast Weekly Newsletter to keep up with the world of Fiction Pods & Audio Drama. Including new releases, jobs, audition calls, collabs, events, creator resources & more.

Explode your podcast listenership — Rockable is the only ad network built specifically for growing podcasts. Join HGTV, Salesforce, and other top podcasters growing their show with Rockable.

PM Virtual Recordings Available Now! — featuring over nearly 100 hours of on-demand video from sessions that happened live at the world's largest virtual podcasting event. Topics from growth to measurement to creative, and a lot more!

  • Ever wondered what The Daily would sound like without the post-production? From the New York Times, The Daily will do a live broadcast today between 4pm and 8pm Eastern. We're promised Michael Barbaro and journalists from across the US.
  • Music magazine publisher Rolling Stone has partnered with Cumulus Media's Westwood One to market and distribute Useful Idiots with Matt Taibbi and Katie Halper and Rolling Stone Music Now
  • ListenNotes has added a "listen score" to podcasts on their platform, which functions as a popularity index. According to their data, Podnews ranks as a "top 2%" show, with a listen score of 41. The listen score is used in the podcast directory's search function.
  • Pocket Casts Paid Placements, in-app advertising for shows, are now sold out until February, we're told.
  • Stitcher rolls out "an all-new app" shortly. They're changing their "favoriting" button to read "follow" - so if you talk about Stitcher on your podcast, you'll want to say "follow us on Stitcher" from hereon in.
  • We Are Podcast has an event on November 5/6, focusing on how to make money from your podcast. Our Editor, James Cridland, is speaking.

Sorry A few Podnews subscribers were erroneously sent a copy of Sounds Profitable yesterday. Not our plan. Sorry.

Tips and tricks

  • How to launch a podcast when you‚Äôve got no following (Rachel Corbett)
  • How to reach a million podcast downloads (for zero spend) when you‚Äôre not a celebrity‚Ä¶ (from the Slimming World podcast)

Podcast News

  • On Vurbl Voices, Paul talks with the co-founders of KidNuz about the audio news format, storytelling, crafting your voice, distributing to the classroom and opportunities around audio for kids and families. Listen on Vurbl
  • My Neighbours Are Dead talks to the lesser known characters from your favorite horror films, and for all of October has been focusing on Friday the 13th.
  • The Red Note is a bilingual podcast, hosted by award-winning journalist Lydia Cacho about the stories behind thousands of women who have been brutally murdered or disappeared along the border in Ciudad Ju√°rez, Mexico. It's available in English...
  • ...and in Spanish as La Nota Roja, and uncovers corruption and cover-up from the authorities.

item.title: Australian Podcast Awards 2020 nominees announced
item.description:
The best Australian podcasts are announced; and one Aussie podcast publisher sees revenue almost double. Plus, news from India, and podcast privacy.
Visit https://podnews.net/update/apa-2020-nom-nom-noms for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/apa-2020-nom-nom-noms for all the links, and to subscribe.

  • The nominees were announced for the 2020 Australian Podcast Awards. You can also vote for the Listeners' Choice, too.
  • PodcastOne Australia, which is operated by Southern Cross Austereo, saw an increase of 96% in revenue in the financial year ending June 30. It brought in AUD$4.6 (US$3.2m) in revenue.
  • In India, Podcash is looking for beta users - it's a service to help podcast producers in India to connect with advertisers and monetise their content.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

Alitu.com Makes Podcast Creation Dead Easy! — Alitu is a web tool that can automate your production. It polishes your audio, adds music, combines clips, adds transitions & offers super-easy editing tools. Save hours & beat the tech stress!

Book A Podcast Studio Near You — Top podcast recording studios are listed on Podcast Rental and are ready to help produce your next episode. Peruse the listings and request a booking today!

Podcasting, Seriously from Lantigua Williams & Co. — Sessions on metrics to chart a show's sustainable growth; editing that refines podcast content; interviewing, choosing the right guest, prepping and composing the final episode.

üí∞ Interested in building a podcast membership? — Check out Supercast's free Guide to Podcast Memberships to learn how you can leverage a paid membership model on your podcast. Learn more ‚Üí

Spark NOW Summit for Faith based Podcasters — The Spark NOW Summit, Nov 6th focuses on growth in social media, branding, interview skills, and the power of story to make an impact. Meet with literary agents about turning your podcast into a book!

  • Khabri, a Hindi-language podcast app in India, has revealed data showing most listeners are male, and aged under 24.
  • Podnews has added privacy information to our podcast pages - so you know which podcasts may contain tracking, dynamic content insertion, or are being served insecurely. This adds to the podcast hosting data we've listed since January. The data is open and community-maintained - see our 'tech stuff' section for more.

Thank you to Chad Whittle for becoming our latest supporter. Twice monthly on The Chad Whittle Podcast, Dr. Chad Whittle is joined by professionals from the media industry to discuss the latest tech developments.

The Tech Stuff

  • How do you know if a podcast is using web-tracking or dynamic ad insertion? You could roll your own database, or - as of today - use an open list containing the capabilities of podcast hosts and podcast prefix companies. Unlike other examples, this contains verification information, and is community-maintained.

    • The privacy data is also synched to the podcast-privacy tool, which contains a JSON API and NPM package.
  • PowerPress 8.4.1 was released at the end of last week. It includes a submission tool to The Podcast Index and to Amazon Music.
  • Podcast Index has added podcast pages for every podcast in the index.
  • A podcast thumbnail image server is up and running. podcastimages·com has a promise of no logging.
  • Whatever happened to OPUS? A good, open, audio format, that sounds great at lower bitrates - here's a sample feed containing one piece of audio in Opus format. Looks like iOS users are out of luck, but this format plays for Android users.

Tips and tricks

  • How to get Separate Audio Files for Each Participant on a Zoom Call (Justin Phillips)
  • Vocal exercises for podcasters (The Podcast Host)

Podcast News

  • On Vurbl Voices, Paul talks with the co-founders of KidNuz about the audio news format, storytelling, crafting your voice, distributing to the classroom and opportunities around audio for kids and families. Listen on Vurbl
  • Source Material is a new podcast series from Vice News, which will detail current events using only user-generated content, such as cellphone, livestream, or CCTV footage.
  • Slow Burn has announced its sixth season, which will focus on the 1992 Los Angeles riots. Season five has yet to air; that's coming in Q1 next year, exploring the lead-up to the Iraq war.

Our supporters:

item.title: Biden vs Trump - who's spending where in podcasts
item.description:
Who's spending more - Biden or Trump? Could Netflix be producing a competitor to podcasting? And using other people's words will need royalties soon
Visit https://podnews.net/update/podcast-spending-presidential-election for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/podcast-spending-presidential-election for all the links, and to subscribe.

Sounds Profitable, our ad-tech newsletter, is really close on hitting its first thousand subscribers. If you've interest in podcast advertising, privacy, programmatic or the nuts and bolts about how podcasting is increasingly paid-for, we'd heartily recommend it. It's free, and comes out every Monday. Subscribe here (and share it, and Podnews, with colleagues). Thanks!

  • How have the presidential candidates used podcast advertising in the US election? Magellan AI says that Trump virtually stopped spending in September and only advertised in news and culture shows. Joe Biden started in late August, after he was officially announced as candidate - but he's advertised a lot on... comedy shows.
  • It's not podcasting, but Netflix could soon allow you to listen to, rather than watch, your favourite shows, according to new code in the app. Back on January 31, Podnews reader Ken Randall noticed that TV shows with audio description would make for a great podcast. We'd agree.
  • Using clips of comedy in your podcast? Expect a knock on your door before too long: Spoken Giants is a new royalty administration agency for the spoken word - much like a music publisher earns royalties for song composers.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

Grow your audience with Castro Promoted Podcasts — Find new subscribers and get downloads. Take your show to the next level with Inbox and Discover ads in the Castro iOS App.

CombinedHosting.com — Yes-you can! You can (and should) host your website together with your podcast in the same place! Yes you can (and should) own your RSS, containing your own domain (not anybody else's)! And much more!

  • Reuters has released its Reuters Audio Survey, a global survey of, among others, attendees of the VOICE Global conference. Daily News podcasts, and interview podcasts, are among the content most likely to increase in demand, the survey says - music, radio and serialised podcasts less so. 80% believe voice-connected homes will soon become the norm.
  • In podcasting, host-read ads work better than non-host-read ads, says new research from Nielsen.
  • It's the fourth anniversary of the New York Times Audio team. The team have posted an update.
  • PRX has published an excerpt from the independent investigation into systemic racism at the company.
  • Libsyn have demonstrated their much-awaited Libsyn5 podcast dashboard. It features a new visual look and feel for stats, and simpler podcast publishing.
  • Quarterly results have been coming out this week.

    • Amazon's net income tripled year-on-year.
    • Spotify now has 320m monthly active users: up 29% year-on-year. 22% of them used podcasts (up 1% from last quarter).
    • Facebook's total users in the US and Canada dropped slightly.
  • Transistor has added one-click submitting tools to podcast directories.
  • In India, today is Spotify Podcasters Day: a masterclass and networking day with more than 25,000 creators having registered.
  • National Podcast Post Month - NaPodPoMo - starts on November 1st. The goal of NaPodPoMo is to use the challenge of podcasting daily as a form of podcasting bootcamp.
  • Evo Terra's changed his mind about PINOs. Podcasters who don't understand RSS, editing tools or podcast tech - Podcasters In Name Only - are just as valuable, he says, as the more full-stack podcasters.

Tips and tricks

  • The Best Podcast Hosts are highlighted by The Podcast Host. (Our Editor is an advisor for one of this article's choices).
  • How to share your podcast on Instagram Reels (Wavve)\
  • How I make True Crime Reporter (Robert Riggs)

Podcast News

  • For the US presidential election, On The Media's Brooke Gladstone and Bob Garfield will be hosting their first-ever live election night show, featuring expert interviews, music, comedy, and reflections and reactions from the OTM crew. It's free to watch.
  • The second season of Dr Death has hit #1 on Apple Podcasts. This season is about Dr Farid Fata, who subjected over 500 patients to brutal chemo treatments they did not need, just to collect millions from insurance; and it unveils a rotten system that tried to protect him.
  • There are lots of non-US podcasts out there that are worth a listen. Foreign Policy Playlist is a new show from Foreign Policy magazine that will recommend one podcast from around the world each week, interview the host, and play an excerpt.

Our supporters:

Gold supporters:Riverside.fm, Buzzsprout, Resonate Recordings, WideOrbit, Jar Audio, Voxnest, Simplecast, Awesound, Call for Content, Podimo, Acast, Podcorn, Amazon Music, Luminary, Chant, Knit, Evergreen Podcasts, We Edit Podcasts, Megaphone, Libsyn, The Roost, Himalaya, Adonde Media, Legal Talk Network, One of One Productions Podcast Studio, ART19, Engle, Entale, Spotify for Podcasters, Focusrite, Podpage websites, The Podcast Haven, backtracks.fm

Silver supporters:POST by Futuri, Raleigh Podcasting, Omny Studio, Message Heard, Fireside, Bullhorn, Lantigua Williams and Co, Bababam, Castbox, Lemonada Media, The Podcast Engineer, RockWater Industries, Podcasters Directory, Podcast Ad Report, Muddy Knees Media, NPR, TPX - The Podcast Exchange Canada, Heartcast Media50, Feed Ignite, Podr, podcast.co, Podcastpage, Build A Cast, Sonic Influencer Marketing, WaitWhat, Amaeya Media, Dante 32, audioBoom, Podcast Taxi, The Chad Whittle Podcast, Zvook, Transistor, Pacific Content, Headliner, Whooshkaa, Synth, Diversion Podcasts, Castos, Glisten Media Podcast Production, Jam Street Media, Ampel, Podcast Guests, Rachel Corbett\s Podschool, Oxford Road, Know or Not? Podcast Network, Chartable, StreamGuys, Ad Results Media, Content10x, Podiant, Podcast Partnership, DAX, Creative Zombie Studios, EverythingWithPodcasting, StatsRadio, nlogic, Alitu, She Podcasts, Lower Street, Margarita Noriega, adswizz, Veritone One, Cleanfeed, Stakhanov, School of Podcasting, Sonix, Revolver Podcasts, Wondery, Adopter Media, Podigy, Cadence13, Blubrry, Podcast Movement, Podknife, Midroll, Edison Research, Signal Hill Insights

item.title: Acast and AdsWizz make podcast ads easier to buy
item.description:
Podcasts placed on the platforms ad agencies already use; and able to be contextually targeted. Plus, Joe Rogan gives publicity to a crackpot again.
Visit https://podnews.net/update/ads-easier-to-buy for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/ads-easier-to-buy for all the links, and to subscribe.

  • It's going to be easier for media agencies to buy podcast ads with Acast, which has made more than 20,000 shows available to buyers on FreeWheel's Strata platform. Strata is already used by more than 1,100 ad agencies - so buying podcast ads is just a click away.
  • Meanwhile, AdsWizz is making 1,000,000 podcast episodes available for advertising using contextual targeting. The technology enables advertisers to target shows based on subjects discussed, and helps them avoid inadvertently being on shows mentioning things they'd rather their brand wasn't next to, like shows featuring anti-vaccination conspiracy theories, for example.
  • Alex Jones guested on The Joe Rogan Experience, featuring anti-vaccination conspiracy theories. They've no basis in truth and threaten public health, and critics have called Jones's appearance 'disgusting'. Spotify's legal officer sent an internal memo defending the company's stance on 'diverse points of view'; Jones was kicked off Apple, Spotify, Facebook and YouTube earlier this year.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

Grow your audience with Castro Promoted Podcasts — Find new subscribers and get downloads. Take your show to the next level with Inbox and Discover ads in the Castro iOS App.

It's not too late to take part in Podcast Movement — PM is under way and officially ends tonight, but it's not too late to register for a PLUS Pass to enjoy the rest of the event live, and gain access to all recordings. Use code PODNEWS to save $50!

Work at City Cast — Love your city? We're launching a network of daily local news podcasts, and we're hiring hosts, producers, reporters, and editors in cities across the U.S. Real jobs, excellent pay, super benefits.

  • The latest podcast hosting company to support podcast locking is Transistor, who have announced full support. From The Podcast Index, this is a best-practice tag that aims to make podcast piracy harder than just six steps. We'd encourage other podcast hosts to step up.
  • Portland Pod's Tanner Campbell has launched a podcast editing course on AppSumo. Normally this course costs $429, but for a limited time it's just $24.
  • Brian Benedik (Spotify, iHeart, Katz) has been hired as Strategic Advisor for Targetspot.
  • The Australian Podcast Awards will announce their nominations this Saturday lunchtime, in a live stream on their website.
  • US radio folks might enjoy listening to the Radio Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony, tonight at 7pm Eastern.

Tips and tricks

  • Podcast Marketing Strategies That Work (Jack Rhysider)
  • How to Bring Your Podcast Back From the Dead (RSS Podcasting)
  • Who's using what tools to do podcast interviews? Data from InterviewValet suggests that SquadCast is growing fast; but Zoom is the #1 thing.

Podcast News

  • Red Flags is the first true-crime podcast in a new slate from Investigation Discovery. It's "a weekly talk show designed to be a one-stop shop for all the latest buzz in the true crime world."
  • Last Day returns for a second season, focusing the growing suicide crisis with an emphasis on hope and finding solutions. From Lemonada and co-sponsored by the JED Foundation, this season is already achieving three times the amount of plays.
  • Behind The Podcast is a new show from The Australian Podcast Awards - which dives into the stories behind how some of the country's most interesting and successful podcasts are created. First up is Kate Watson from The Squiz.
  • Featuring an original score, DRAMA - an aural experience is a new short-story audio series featuring the world of the supernatural, paranormal, and mysterious. Perfect on the run-up to Halloween.

item.title: Podchaser launches Pro service for marketers
item.description:
A new service for marketers to find shows; Joe Rogan is still the most listened-to podcast; Audible adds podcasts in some places
Visit https://podnews.net/update/podchaser-pro-launches for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/podchaser-pro-launches for all the links, and to subscribe.

  • Podchaser Pro has been launched. The service offers estimated reach, demographics and social figures for podcasts, as well as contacts; it's meant to help advertisers and PR people discover new shows. In case you're interested, this is our page on the service.
  • MediaMonitors has unveiled the results of its latest survey of US podcast listening. Undertaken in the last two weeks of September, it shows The Joe Rogan Experience as the most listened-to podcast, with new entries at #9 for The Michelle Obama Podcast and at #13, iHeartRadio's Paper Ghosts. Michelle Obama's podcast was exclusive to Spotify during the survey period. Media Monitors, which is owned by iHeartRadio, also claims iHeartRadio is the #1 podcast publisher - based on the number of shows in the top 25 200.
  • Audible has added "100,000 free podcasts" to their app, says The Verge. This seems a geographic rollout - we don't see them in the Audible app in Australia - yet, anyway. (Are we there? )

Classifieds - your job or ad here

Fiction Podcast or Audio Drama Junkie? Roll up! — Get the Fiction Podcast Weekly Newsletter to keep up with the world of Fiction Pods & Audio Drama. Including new releases, jobs, audition calls, collabs, events, creator resources & more.

It's not too late to take part in Podcast Movement — PM is under way and officially ends tomorrow, but it's not too late to register for a PLUS Pass to enjoy the rest of the event live, and gain access to all recordings. Use code PODNEWS to save $50!

Birthful Podcast Joins Lantigua Williams & Co. — Working birth doula Adriana Lozada talks pregnancy, birth and postpartum with top experts and new parents. Distills the overload of pregnancy information down to the most relevant and useful bits.

üí∞ Interested in building a podcast membership? — Check out Supercast's free Guide to Podcast Memberships to learn how you can leverage a paid membership model on your podcast. Learn more ‚Üí

  • Exclusive: The CuriousCast podcast network in Canada has partnered with Podcast Radio in the UK to bring new shows to listeners to the radio station. Among the podcasts to be featured will be Crime Beat, Dark Poutine, and The Ongoing History of New Music. The shows join Podnews, which broadcasts podcast updates every day on the station.
  • Placements·io has signed with Megaphone to integrate with the company. The release says that Megaphone will work with Placements·io to streamline the process of buying and selling podcast advertising inventory.
  • TWiT has announced they're to test Podsights for attribution data.
  • iVoox has expanded its catalog of iVoox Originals - exclusive, free podcasts - to "more than 129".
  • A new podcast service has launched. BrandStoryCasting is aimed at business podcasters, and offers a private web-based studio, pre- and post-production , and hosting.

Tips and tricks

  • Why you should have a podcast website (Spreaker)
  • How to write podcast edit notes (East Coast Studio)

Podcast News

  • ·êÉ·ìÑ·êÉ·ë¶ ·êÖ·ìÇ·íÉ·ë≥·ñè·ë¶ is a podcast in Inuktitut, from the CBC in Canada. Using the CBC's archives, it allows some first nation people to hear their ancestors, and their stories, for the very first time.
  • The Verge has announced a replacement for Recode Decode. Decoder has published a trailer. It will launch on November 10, hosted by Verge editor-in-chief Nilay Patel.
  • PRX and Seeker have announced two new science shows for kids. Launching today, That's Totally Normal talks about the changes in your body during adolescence; a new show follows in December focusing on inventions. It's part of TRAX, PRX's podcast network for 9-13 year-olds.
  • The Miami Chronicles: Booby Trap is a new true-crime podcast about significant crimes that have taken place in Miami FL, USA. It starts in North Miami, and a murder of a 14 year-old that revealed a dark secret.

item.title: Shure launches MV7 USB/XLR microphone
item.description:
A new USB version of Joe Rogan's microphone. Or Roman Mars's microphone. Or Michael Jackson's microphone. No Agenda is 13; and multilingual podcasts
Visit https://podnews.net/update/shure-mv7-microphone for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/shure-mv7-microphone for all the links, and to subscribe.

  • Shure have launched the Shure MV7 microphone. US$249, it gets a glowing review in Forbes. With XLR and USB output and an app to help control it, it's based on the Shure SM7B used by Michael Jackson, Joe Rogan, and Roman Mars.
  • After its acquisition by SiriusXM earlier this year, the podcast app Stitcher is to get a redesign.
  • Adam Curry and John C Dvorak celebrated thirteen years doing No Agenda this week.

Classifieds - your job or ad here

It's not too late to take part in Podcast Movement — PM is under way from now until Thursday the 29, but it's not too late to register for a PLUS Pass to enjoy the rest of the event live, and gain access to all recordings. Use code PODNEWS to save $50!

Why can lawyers do EVERYTHING? — You Are A Lawyer is a bimonthly show about lawyers who ditched the courtroom to find success. Guests include accountants, yogis, and beauty brand creators who use their law degrees in innovative ways.

Freedom Brokers Subscribe Now! — Insight from today‚Äôs toP players in the defense community. Trainers, action sports and outdoor icons.

Alitu.com Makes Podcast Creation Dead Easy! — Alitu is a web tool that can automate your production. It polishes your audio, adds music, combines clips, adds transitions & offers super-easy editing tools. Save hours & beat the tech stress!

Work at City Cast — Love your city? We're launching a network of daily local news podcasts, and we're hiring hosts, producers, reporters, and editors in cities across the U.S. Real jobs, excellent pay, super benefits.

Spark NOW Summit for Faith based Podcasters — The Spark NOW Summit, Nov 6th focuses on growth in social media, branding, interview skills, and the power of story to make an impact. Meet with literary agents about turning your podcast into a book!

  • A press release says: "PodBooking- The LinkedIn of Podcasting Has Arrived"
  • Spotify executive Sten Garmark is quoted in a story behind the paywall at Business Insider: "The thing we are most excited about right now is finally getting to the point where we have so many consumers and so many creators on the same software stack, and that hasn't really happened in audio before ... So continuing the journey on format innovation to go solve problems that no other company can solve but Spotify."
  • The Athletic is partnering with Megaphone for podcast distribution and monetisation. The Athletic is a subscription-based sports publisher.
  • In the UK, Pods Up North have announced a new virtual event to help you grow and evolve your podcast. It's a "pay as you feel" event.
  • Want some good podcast recommendations? Sara's Podcast Newsletter is full of them (and lots of animated GIFs).

Thank you to Resonate Recordings, for increasing the level of their support. An easier way to podcast, they offer a comprehensive podcast editing service and production platform. You can support us too.

Tips and tricks

  • How to make multilingual podcasts (Lory Martinez from Studio Ochenta, speaking at Podcast Day)
  • How to network with other podcast hosts (DiscoverPods)

Podcast News

  • In The Jordan Harbinger Show today, the first one-on-one interview from the infamous Fyre Fest organiser Billy McFarland, via a collect call from the Elkton, OH federal correctional facility where he‚Äôs currently serving out his sentence. He was given three months in solitary confinement for having a USB flash drive.
  • How Cool Is This? is a five-minute podcast about what's cool, "perfect for a short commute from the bedroom to the kitchen," they say (too soon, guys!) They're going daily from today, with episodes exploring different political ideas, right up to the election. Anyone can submit their political idea to the show by calling +1-848-863-9917.
  • Indigenous people have lived in Australia for thousands of years, and have formed a spiritual relationship with the land - including the spirits on the other side. Indigenous Ghost Stories is new from Australia's National Indigenous Television. (We should also take this opportunity to acknowledge the Turrbal and Jagera people, the traditional owners of the land on which Podnews is prepared every day.)

item.title: iHeartMedia to buy podcast host Voxnest
item.description:
Voxnest to supply iHeartMedia with dynamic ad insertion and analytics. Captivate unveils AMIE; the Discover Pods Awards finalists; does podcasting need government regulation? And music with shows (again)
Visit https://podnews.net/update/iheartmedia-voxnest for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/iheartmedia-voxnest for all the links, and to subscribe.

Demographic targeting rightfully receives attention from advertisers and agencies, but what are its limits within podcasting? Should we be aiming for the hyper-targeted individual or instead focus on the digital household? - from this week's Sounds Profitable with Podsights, our adtech newsletter. Subscribe now.

  • iHeartMedia is to acquire Voxnest. Voxnest will provide dynamic ad serving for iHeartRadio's podcasts and analytics. Voxnest also owns Spreaker, the 6th largest podcast host with 61,000 shows, and BlogTalkRadio, with a further 8,300. Terms weren't disclosed.

    • iHeart currently hosts with Megaphone; but has hosted with Spreaker in the past.
  • Podcast host Captivate have unveiled AMIE, their "audio mastering and integration engine" which is now in private beta. The tool offers dynamic content insertion for all podcasters on the platform, and also includes a proprietary audio processing tool. (Podnews's Editor is an advisor).
  • The finalists have been announced for the 2020 Discover Pods Awards. You have until November 6 to vote for the winners. Podnews is in the "best news podcast"; but we're up against The Daily, Up First, Pod Save America and Today, Explained, so—anyway, thanks for the finalist status!

Classifieds - your job or ad here

Book A Podcast Studio Near You — Top podcast recording studios are listed on Podcast Rental and are ready to help produce your next episode. Peruse the listings and request a booking today!

It's not too late to take part in Podcast Movement — PM is under way from now until Thursday the 29, but it's not too late to register for a PLUS Pass to enjoy the rest of the event live, and gain access to all recordings. Use code PODNEWS to save $50!

Freedom Brokers Subscribe Now! — Insight from today‚Äôs toP players in the defense community. Trainers, action sports and outdoor icons.

üí∞ Interested in building a podcast membership? — Check out Supercast's free Guide to Podcast Memberships to learn how you can leverage a paid membership model on your podcast. Learn more ‚Üí

Work at City Cast — Love your city? We're launching a network of daily local news podcasts, and we're hiring hosts, producers, reporters, and editors in cities across the U.S. Real jobs, excellent pay, super benefits.

Spark NOW Summit for Faith based Podcasters — The Spark NOW Summit, Nov 6th focuses on growth in social media, branding, interview skills, and the power of story to make an impact. Meet with literary agents about turning your podcast into a book!

  • Big Tech Comes for Podcasts - "Silicon Valley could wreck audio journalism", claims an article in Washington Monthly, arguing that we need government regulation to keep podcasting healthy.
  • Director of Radio James Purnell is to leave the BBC next week. A former Labour MP who was responsible for BBC Sounds, the corporation's audio app, he was publicly sidelined by the new DG, Tim Davie. He moves to be President and Vice-Chancellor at the University of Arts in London; but must have been in a hurry to leave - that job starts in March.

    • New government rules on redundancy payouts mean we're likely to see a rush of people leaving the BBC over the next few weeks; David Robey, the Station Editor of BBC Radio London, suddenly departed on Friday.
  • Podshape, an Australian podcast publisher, has got one of its shows into a new Spotify "Daily Wellness" podcast playlist; and launched three new shows.
  • The founders of Gotham Podcast Studio have unveiled their own community-focused hosting company. Tandem Podcasting launches with member profiles and a live member chat service.
  • Spotify's "music with shows" seems to have been possible for some time. Tom Mullen contacts us to point us to two projects he's worked with - a track-by-track with Kranium, an artist at Atlantic done in February, and Duran Duran Radio's WHOOOSH!, with Simon Le Bon and Katy Krassner, now at episode 27.

    • It's possible to do the same with YouTube. See "the tech stuff" below.
  • mp3DirectCut, a direct MP3 editor (which edits without re-encoding), is now available on Android.

Thank you to the users at Podhero for supporting Podnews! (You can support your favourite shows here, too).

The Tech Stuff

There's been significant movement in the new Podcast Index podcast namespace. With the locking, transcript, funding and chapters data all being returned in the API responses, a lot of support has already been announced.

  • Fireside is now supporting publishing of the locking, funding and transcript tags; and will obey the locking tag for imports early this week.
  • Castopod, an open-source podcast hosting platform, now supports the locking tag (both for import and publish). The service now also uses OPAWG's RSS useragents list to enhance analytics. Funded by the NGI0 Discovery Fund by NLnet, you can grab the source and download it today.
  • Hypercatcher, "an Interactive Podcast App unlike any other", now supports the podcast:chapters tag.
  • Podfriend now supports the funding tag. (It's in our feed, too, if you want to see how it works).
  • Blubrry now has a tool to help you submit your podcast to the Podcast Index. (This works for anyone - no need to be hosted with Blubrry).
  • Adam Curry writes that we shouldn't forget the listeners - asking for testing tools. A reminder that Dave Jones and Adam Curry's Podcasting 2.0 podcast is not on Apple (or Spotify).
  • Is there a better way to attribute platforms and apps than a useragent? This audio query string proposal from our Editor probably has a lot of holes in it, but feedback is welcome.
  • Want to do a "Spotify show with music" but using YouTube's catalogue instead? You can do it with a playlist - and It turns out that you can do quite a creditable version using the YouTube Javascript API - properly mixing and talking over the songs and jingles and all that. (That bit does, however, come with a few gotchas).

Tips and tricks

  • It all comes down to being authentic, says Aussie podcaster Christian Hull.
  • Advertising a podcast - a three part series from Sean Howard focuses on how to promote your podcast in many different ways.

Podcast News

  • The Mother Jones Podcast is hosting their first ever live podcast show tomorrow at 4pm EST.
  • NRC, a national broadsheet newspaper in the Netherlands, is concerned about "the platforms of major tech companies that control the market". It's to move their shows like NRC Vandaag, their daily news podcast, into their own app, NRC Audio. From January 1, the website says, "certain NRC podcasts will only be available to subscribers".

Photographs

In Europe, Podcast Day started a few hours ago (at the time of writing). Here's a snapshot of the Ear Hustle session with Earlonne Woods.
